result.execSummary:
The defendant Daryl A. Ekholm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daryl A. Ekholm

records.addlTxt: 2:45 Defendant Daryl A. Ekholm in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 17CF80, 18CT11,16CM70 heard at this time. Mr Ekholm states he made payment today. Walker: guilty to 16CM70 with $443 cost, guilty to Ct#3 in 17CF60 with DJOC, dismiss #1,2,4 in 17CF60, dismiss 17CF80 and 18CT11. Amend bond conditions in 17CF60. Atty Chapman and Defendant agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Defendat pleas guilty to 16CM70 and Ct#3 in 17CF60; Chapman stipulates to factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of 16CM70. Court finds Def guilty of Ct#3 in 17CF60, withholds entry of judgment of conviction. Dismisses 17CF80, 18CT11, Ct#1,2,4 in 17CF60. Atty Walker and Chapman address sentencing.  Court orders $443.00 costs in 16CM70; 1 year to pay. Court approves agreement on 17CF60 and signs. Def to pay at least $100 a month for attorney fees. 3:00

9:26 Defendant Daryl A. Ekholm in court. 16CM70,17CF80 and 18CT11 following along. Court notes Defendant made a $750 payment yesterday. Daryl states he should be able to make the remaining $250 next week. Court: $1000 payment in October. $500/month November 2018  through March 2019. If cases are not resolved $1000 again in April  2019. This is a court order. 9:29
Payment hearing on September 19, 2018 at 09:00 am.
Copy of wage assignment was mailed to Def with a reminder to pay for attorney fees.

Hearing on October 15, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on November 8, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Dan Chapman
Status conference on April 17, 2018 at 11:00 am.

4:03 p.m.  Defendant Daryl A. Ekholm in court.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 17CF60, 17CF80 and 18CT11.  Walker, Defendant still in the process of retaining counsel, requests postponement of status at this time.  Court addresses Ekholm regarding retaining an attorney.  Court - reset for 30 days out, defendant to have attorney at that time or do waiver of counsel and represent himself.  JA to schedule for Status Conference in 30 days.  4:06 p.m.

03:26 16CM70 also at this time for final pre-trial, 17CF80 following. Defendant Daryl A. Ekholm in court, in custody VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Walker: trial scheduled. Defendant says he wishes to obtain an attorney for cases set for trial. Court: Jury Trial will be continued, set for Status so that defendant can obtain an attorney. Court advises defendant to contact Public Defender's office, if he does not qualify he is advised to apply for County appointed attorney. 03:31  Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2018 at 04:00 pm.

10:20 Defendant Daryl A. Ekholm in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Court gives constitutional rights to the court room as a group. Each Defendant in a group exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty. Court rec/enter. Froelich: $2000 signature bond. Defendant has no objection.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 04:15 pm.
